title: Luminary Tour: Language of Beauty (January 18)
title_display: Luminary Tour: The Language of Beauty in African Art
hero_caption: Face Mask, 20th century. Probably Ubi; Côte d’Ivoire. Private collection, Belgium. Photo by Hughes Dubois.
short_description:
On this guided small-group tour, join fellow Luminary to explore The Language of Beauty in African Art with Constantine Petridis, chair and curator of Arts of Africa.

Open exclusively to Luminary members, this tour requires advance registration and is limited to 12 participants. The tour lasts approximately 50 minutes.
list_description: On this guided small-group tour, join fellow Luminary to explore The Language of Beauty in African Art with Constantine Petridis, chair and curator of Arts of Africa.
description:
Luminary are invited to connect with Constantine Petridis, chair and curator of Arts of Africa, and explore the philosophical, social, political, and religious themes within the exhibition The Language of Beauty in African Art.

Open exclusively to Luminary members, this tour requires advance registration and is limited to 12 participants. The tour lasts approximately 50 minutes. 

So that you can enjoy your experience safely, all museum visiting policies at the time of the event must be observed.

Contact Us

If you have questions or are interested in learning more about Luminary membership, we’d be delighted to hear from you. Please contact us at (312) 443-3735 or luminary@artic.edu.
buy_button_caption:
$50 per person
This tour is limited to 12 participants.
